BR_text.BRdescription:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/nnsuite/nnstreamer/blob/master/gst/tensor_split/gsttensorsplit.c#L41>https://github.com/nnsuite/nnstreamer/blob/master/gst/tensor_split/gsttensorsplit.c#L41</denchmark-link>
 
 In the above code, it states:
 <denchmark-code>gst-launch -v -m filesrc location=testcase_RGB_100x100.png ! pngdec ! videoscale ! imagefreeze ! videoconvert ! video/x-raw,format=RGB,width=100,height=100,framerate=0/1 ! tensor_converter
 ! tensorsplit name=split tensorseg=1:100:100:2,1:100:100:1 split.src_0 ! queue ! filesink location=src0.log
 split.src_1 ! queue ! filesink location=src1.log
 </denchmark-code>
 
 However, an 100x100 RGB video is supposed to have 3:100:100. You cannot have 1💯100:3 from it. It appears that you've used C-array notation instead of tensor-dimension notation. If you have assume that 1:100:100:3 is really for video, you need to review and recheck the whole code.

comments_0.comment_text:
: Thank you for posting issue <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nnstreamer/nnstreamer/issues/538>#538</denchmark-link>
 . The person in charge will reply soon.
